abstract: Michael Fertik, founder of ReputationDefender, and Paul Ohm, a law professor at the University of Colorado, respond to readers questions about legislation, deleting social networking accounts and influencing Google search results.
snippet: Michael Fertik, founder of ReputationDefender, and Paul Ohm, a law professor at the University of Colorado, respond to readers questions about legislation, deleting social networking accounts and influencing Google search results.
lead_paragraph: Last week, we asked readers to submit questions to Michael Fertik, founder of ReputationDefender, and Paul Ohm, a law professor at the University of Colorado, in response to The New York Times Magazine article “The Web Means the End of Forgetting.”

headline.main: Part I: Answers to Questions About Internet Privacy
